item.title: Amazon Luna: Every Free Game With Prime (February 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Devil May Cry 5
  • Hot Wheels Unleashed 2: Turbocharged
  • Nobody Saves The World
  • Other Amazon Luna Games That Are Free With Prime
  • Games That Have Been Free With Prime For A While
  • Luna Games That Were Previously Free With Prime

Originally revealed in 2020 and made available to a select group of people, Amazon Luna officially launched on March 1, 2022, in the United States, before expanding to the UK, Canada, and Germany. A cloud-based service, Amazon Luna offers subscribers an opportunity to stream a curated selection of games, with its library being divided into a few channels that each come with a unique monthly price.

Besides the channels, Amazon Luna also grants Prime subscribers access to a handful of free games per month; at the moment, four titles are usually the standard, although some temporary surprises might be included. Since Amazon Luna requires a stable internet connection to work, with 10 Mbps being the recommended speed, Prime owners can test the service using these titles before looking into the platform's channels. It also helps that Amazon Luna's free games for Prime lineup are generally pretty good.

These Amazon Luna's Free Games with Prime will be available between February 1–28, 2025.

Devil May Cry 5

A Challenging Hack And Slash Epic

The main attraction of Amazon Luna's free games with Prime lineup for February 2025, Devil May Cry 5 is an interesting and, arguably, confident pick. Capcom's 2019 hack and slash title does not provide much room for error, and quick reflexes are important for offensive and defensive moves. If the streaming performance is not up-to-scratch and adds even a hint of sluggishness to the gameplay, DMC 5 can become frustrating.

As such, this game should be a good litmus test for Prime subscribers who have never tried Luna. If they enjoy their time with DMC 5 , there is a good chance that most other titles will be enjoyable, at least in terms of playability.

Hot Wheels Unleashed 2: Turbocharged

A Gorgeous Arcade Racer With Accessible Controls

Another Amazon Luna with Prime game that should test a player's streaming capabilities, Hot Wheels Unleashed 2 is a fun arcade racer that delivers stunning visuals, tight controls that focus on drifting and boosting, and a silly campaign that is entertaining for a few hours. While all of that is good, the game's biggest selling point is its collection of cars, providing more than 100 vehicles that players can gradually unlock. There are even fun licensed pieces that might ignite someone's nostalgia.

Nobody Saves The World

A Charming Action RPG

DrinkBox's Nobody Saves the World was among 2022's best indie games, and the "indie" qualifier is arguably unnecessary. The action RPG has a clever twist on the concept of classes. The protagonist, the eponymous Nobody, is a blank slate who can transform into a wide range of forms that are effectively different characters, and they all come with unique abilities and stats. The concept works well and presents plenty of opportunities for experimentation by combining different forms. Outside of this concept, the game is a polished dungeon-crawler with plenty of replayability.

Other Amazon Luna Games That Are Free With Prime

Batora & Ride 4

The following games are also part of Amazon Luna's Free with Prime lineup for February 2025.

Game

Genre

Developer

Amazon Luna Link

Batora: Lost Haven

Action-Adventure

Stormind Games

Link

Ride 4

Racing Sim

Milestone

Link

Games That Have Been Free With Prime For A While

Fallout: New Vegas

Fallout: New Vegas is generally regarded as the high point of the 3D era, at least when it comes to pure role-playing. Obsidian crafted a player-driven campaign that provides plenty of freedom in crafting the Courier's identity and directing his journey through the eponymous city.

Now, New Vegas is quite old by this point, and it was always rather rough around the edges. On PC, the game has a lively modding community that has not only kept it alive but also improved the vanilla content; unfortunately, mods are not an option on Amazon Luna. Still, if someone wants to try out the base version, this freebie should be great.

Fallout 3: Game Of The Year Edition

Considering its accessibility and longevity, Fallout 3 has likely been experienced by anyone who has ever been remotely interested in it. Nevertheless, the 2008 RPG will always be a big deal in its own right, and it is still fun to play all these years later. At the time, Bethesda's shift to a 3D sandbox open-world marked a significant departure from previous Fallout entries, and this decision helped propel the series to new commercial heights.

Nowadays, the standard version of Fallout 3 is antiquated in quite a few areas. The gameplay was never particularly good and has not gotten better with age. While not quite as action-driven as Fallout 4 , the 2008 release does not emphasize player choices as much as New Vegas or the series' isometric releases; however, Fallout 3 still offers solid customization and an awesome playground.

Trackmania Starter Access

Ubisoft's most recent Trackmania project has been around for a couple of years, although it only launched on most platforms in 2023. Unlike most racing games, Trackmania prioritizes time trials and short tracks, with most laps lasting only a small handful of minutes. Although incorporating an online aspect, players will also be competing against themselves as they try to shave a second or two from their best times.

Trackmania is a free-to-play game that only provides a sample of content in its base version. The Starter Access iteration is a bit more robust and should keep people engaged for a while.

Fortnite is also part of Amazon Luna's free games with Prime, along with its spin-off modes like Lego Fortnite Brick Life , Rocket Racing , Fortnite Ballistic , and Fortnite Festival ​​​​​​.

Luna Games That Were Previously Free With Prime

This section maintains a record of all the Amazon Luna games that have been free with Prime since the service's launch on March 1, 2022. These upcoming Amazon Luna games have been free with Prime:

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for February 2, 2025
item.description:
Today’s New York Times Strands puzzle offers another engaging challenge for word enthusiasts. It is a game that tests your ability to find hidden words within a grid of letters, and it can be both rewarding and difficult.

If you already know how to play Strands and are just looking for some help, this article is here to guide you. Here, you can find everything from general clues, spoilers, and even the full answer to today's puzzle if you want to see it.

The NYT Games Strands Album of the Year Puzzle #336 February 2, 2025

The Strands puzzle for today has the clue Album of the Year . There are eight things to find, including the Spangram and the seven themed words.

New York Times Games Strands Clues

If you want some spoiler-free hints to help you with this free mobile puzzle game, you can find three in the sections below. Open up each of these with the "Read More" button underneath each one.

General Hint 1

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

For those who would like a spoiler or two but don't feel like saving up non-themed words to get in-game hints, you can find some words from the puzzle below. Inside each of the two expandable sections are one word and a screenshot of where to find it inside of this mobile puzzle game.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands Album of the Year

The full answer for the New York Times Games Strands puzzle for "Album of the Year" is in the section below. Take a peek inside to see all the themed words, the Spangram, and a screenshot that shows where each of them below.

Today's Strands Explained

Don't get it? If you don't understand the puzzle after solving it, you can find an explanation of the theme and how it relates to the clue in the section below.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: Hello Kitty Island Adventure: Can You Time Travel
item.description:
Hello Kitty Island Adventure is an all-new Hello Kitty experience, bringing together the vibes of Animal Crossing but with everyone's favorite characters from the Sanrio franchise. The game will remind many people of Disney Dreamlight Valley and other cozy games as it mixes a lot of what the players love best in those games; allowing players to live on a cozy island with their villagers and do various things to take care of the area.

Many games allow players to be able to do time travel to skip a period, whether that be a whole season or just a couple of days. One game that does allow this without problems is Animal Crossing: New Horizons , which made it super easy to time travel to see what items would be in the shop the next day, even take part in seasonal events, or get different villagers on the island. However, not every game is cut out for time travel. This guide will explain if players should time travel in Hello Kitty Island Adventure.

Can You Time Travel In Hello Kitty Island Adventure?

When it comes to Hello Kitty Island Adventure and how players can level up and progress, a lot of the way the game is built is around friendship levels, and players can earn more levels within friendships by gifting. Players will need to gift characters presents to level up quickly. However, gifting is limited to a certain number every 24 hours.

Like a lot of recent games, Hello Kitty Island Adventure runs on a 24-hour clock which is connected to real time. The way that people are tricking the game into thinking it is a different day is by going into their device settings, whether that is their Nintendo Switch or PC, and changing the time and date altogether. For example, players first will need to make sure their game has been saved, exit, change the time in their settings, and proceed back into the game and the in-game time will have changed.

Now, there are some issues when it comes to time traveling in Hello Kitty Island Adventure. Upon time traveling and turning the time forward, the game fleshes up an error post, telling the player that the game has sensed some issues with the in-game clock being messed with. After this, it is really hard to fix the issue, as players won't be able to fix the clock back without the clock still being off. This might then require players to uninstall their game altogether, fix their clock, and re-download. This is a reason why players will want to avoid time traveling altogether to avoid losing their game save. That is everything to know about time traveling in Hello Kitty Island Adventure.

item.title: If DC Had Its Own Marvel Rivals, Two Characters Would Have a Rough Go
item.description:
It’s no secret that DC has fallen quite far behind Marvel when it comes to video games. Marvel Rivals is only the latest game to reiterate this, and even though Marvel and DC don’t need to be perpetually locked into a competition between one another it would be wonderful if DC could wield Marvel’s wins as inspiration to produce its own. If that was to manifest itself transparently and unabashedly, DC would hop on the 6v6 hero-shooter bandwagon sooner than later and put forth its own take on Marvel Rivals .

Batman and Superman could have great variety in a DC Marvel Rivals between all of Batman’s gadgets and vehicles or Superman’s yellow sun-fueled Kryptonian abilities. Likewise, characters like Martian Manhunter or Green Lantern could have ridiculously whimsical and creative kits. That said, it’d be nearly impossible to design kits for Aquaman or Green Arrow and not have them mirror Namor and Hawkeye.

DC’s Aquaman Would Never Escape the Watery Shadow of Marvel Rivals’ Namor

Marvel Rivals ’ Namor has proven to be fairly high-tier in Season 1. He’s not the most dynamic Duelist character players can choose from the roster, but his unassumingly powerful Monstro Spawns make up the brunt of his kit while he mainly hurls his trident and rises into the air with a protective bubble in a pinch. It’s a simple set of abilities that hone in on Namor’s character well, and if a DC Marvel Rivals ever came out and had an Aquaman on the roster it would be hard not to have his own abilities merely mimic Namor’s.

Of course, something DC could do is have Aquaman summon other underwater creatures to battle alongside him, though that would still reflect Namor’s Aquatic Dominion ability as well as his Horn of Proteus Ultimate.

Likewise, if Aquaman were able to submerge himself into the map and swim around speedily with a movement boost, that would then lean too heavily on Marvel Rivals ’ Jeff the Land Shark. As a result, there isn’t much that DC could do to greatly distinguish Aquaman, which is unfortunate because his popularity and ubiquitousness would suggest that he’d have to play a role in an ensemble hero-shooter if DC ever decided to develop one.

DC’s Green Arrow Could Have a Trick or Two Up His Sleeve That Marvel Rivals’ Hawkeye Lacks

Marvel Rivals ’ Hawkeye hasn’t been terribly broken in Season 1, but like Namor he’s quite high in many community tier lists. On paper, Green Arrow having a kit designed for a hero-shooter would have trouble avoiding inspiration from Hawkeye; however, while both characters share expertise with a bow and arrow as their weapon of choice, Green Arrow could triple down on another gimmick they both possess that Marvel Rivals ’ Hawkeye doesn’t indulge in much.

Hawkeye only has Blast Arrows as a trick arrow type and instead has more utility with a katana and a wakizashi in his Crescent Slash and Ronin Slash abilities. In this case, a DC Marvel Rivals game would be able to possibly eclipse Hawkeye by giving its Green Arrow a few different trick arrows that enhance his gameplay.

Anything could be on the table between arrows that propel Green Arrow into the air for better traversal and arrows that require a large cooldown but create an AoE with a fun status effect. Either way, with no DC take on Marvel Rivals even rumored, Marvel Rivals doesn’t have to share the limelight with anyone else but Overwatch 2 at the moment.

item.title: Tales of the Shire Has A Big Chance to Stand Out on One Classic Cozy Sim Feature
item.description:
Tales of the Shire: A Lord of the Rings Game is set to take place in the village of Bywater in the Shire, and stands alone as a game in the world of The Lord of the Rings because it's a cozy game rather than an action-oriented game. Rather than engaging in combat, Tales of the Shire 's main premise keeps the player within the bounds of the Shire, homesteading, foraging, and building relationships with the local hobbit inhabitants.

Cozy games often include engaging with a small village community, and one of the best ways to do that is through a holiday system. Many cozy games involve unique festivals and holidays that are tied to the community's culture. As The Lord of the Rings has so much established lore and history, especially for the inhabitants of the Shire, Tales of the Shire should include the holidays and festivals that are detailed in the source material.

Bringing Hobbit Holidays to Tales of the Shire

In The Lord of the Rings , hobbits had their own calendar system separate to the rest of Middle-Earth. As hobbits are an argrarian society, most of their calendar is based around the changing seasons. The Shire was originally based on Tolkien's home country of England, and the hobbit calendar and holidays are very similar to the ones found in England. Holidays that are unique to the Shire would be a natural fit for Tales of the Shire , even considering the canon appendices and going beyond them because of the thousands of years of potential history that hobbits remember in The Lord of the Rings .

In the canon calendar, hobbits have two important holidays, namely the summer solstice and the last and first days of the year, which happen in the middle of winter. Both of these holidays are primarily feast days, although the Lithe Days in the summer are also popular trading days.

Official holidays in the Shire include:

  • 2 Yule
  • 1 Lithe
  • Mid-Year's Day
  • Over-Lithe (only observed on Leap Years)
  • 2 Lithe
  • 1 Yule

Including Hobbit Celebrations in Tales of the Shire

2 Yule is the first day of the year, and the second day of a two-day feast celebrating the New Year. The Lithe Days, also known as The Summerdays in Bree, is a festival between three to four days and places an emphasis on feasting. Both of these festivals happen over several days, but Tales of the Shire could adapt them to instead run for one day, as is typical in cozy games. As the emphasis of these holidays is on feasting, the Tales of the Shire 's core gameplay mechanics of harvesting, cooking, and hosting guests for a meal could play a central role in participating in these festivals, while the Yule festival could include Gandalf and his fireworks to ring in the New Year.

Hobbit Birthday Celebrations

Other celebrations that Tales of the Shire could include are birthday celebrations. Hobbits are depicted as loving birthday parties, and being able to plan and execute parties for NPCs that the player hobbit has a close relationship with should be included. If the player hobbit is close to other NPCs, it would also be great if those NPCs could throw a birthday party for the player hobbit on their birthday, possibly with special characters making cameos at the event.
